alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 12:36AM EDT until June 16 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Escambia County in northwestern Florida... * Until 315 AM CDT. * At 1136 PM CDT, This is becoming a rather serious situation across Pensacola and please heed all warnings and remain off the roads. local law enforcement and emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 6 and 8 inches with locally higher amounts to 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing especially across West Pensacola, Warrington, and Downtown Pensacola. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Gonzalez, Goulding, Myrtle Grove, Olive, Pine Forest, Bellview, Avondale, Brownsville, Ramsey Beach, Millview, Beach Haven, Beulah and Cantonment. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
